content.question: Which of the following is an accurate comparison of devolutionary movements in Spain and Canada?

choices.label: There is an economic aspect to the Quebecois independence movement, while the Catalans focus mainly on culture.
Both independence movements utilize cultural distinctiveness as their only reason for seeking independence.
Both independence movements focus on religious differences with the nations they currently belong to.
There is an economic aspect to the Catalan independence movement, while the Quebecois focus mainly on cultural differences.
Both independence movements utilize economic power as their main reason for seeking independence.

content.answer: There is an economic aspect to the Catalan independence movement, while the Quebecois focus mainly on cultural differences.

skill.text: Skill 5.C: Compare geographic characteristics and processes at various scales.
